responses.rationale: The segment uses factual language ('seeing more geographic spread') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment asks a question using neutral verbs ('stop the spread').
The segment uses neutral verbs ('warned', 'emphasized') and factual descriptions ('likelihood of an outbreak').
The segment factually describes biosecurity measures without high-potency language.
The segment uses neutral verbs ('can contribute to spreading').
The segment factually describes a potential vector without high-potency language.
The segment uses neutral language ('considering how to improve') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment asks a question using neutral language.
The segment describes symptoms factually ('complete paralysis, swelling', 'twisting') without high-potency verbs or metaphors framing the impact alarmingly.
The segment uses neutral verbs ('detected', 'posing') and describes a 'likely threat' which is not a high-potency metaphor or superlative.
